Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: googleClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Gmail accounts, you must enable the Gmail API in your Google API Console and obtain a Client ID for your app’s bundle.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: outlookClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Outlook accounts, you must register your app at the MS Application Registration Portal (https://apps.dev.microsoft.com) and add a Native Application platform. This will generate a Client ID

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: yahooImapId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Yahoo accounts, you must register a Yahoo developer account at https://developer.yahoo.com and then contact mail-api@oath.com to request an IMAP ID

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: yahooClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Yahoo accounts, after obtaining above IMAP ID, create a new app (type=Web Application, callback_domain=microblink.com) at https://developer.yahoo.com.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: yahooClientSecret
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Yahoo accounts, after obtaining above IMAP ID, create a new app (type=Web Application, callback_domain=microblink.com) at https://developer.yahoo.com.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: currentProvider
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If there is a stored provider, this property will indicate which provider it is

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: whitelistedSenders
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Debug property to enable other sender emails to be parsed as ereceipts.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: How far back (in days) to search the user’s inbox for e-receipts

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: userCurrentEmail
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If the OAuth provider supports returning the logged-in email, it will be populated into this property after OAuth or silent authentications

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -beginOAuthForProvider:withViewController:andCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Begins the OAuth process for the given provider (currently only Gmail and Outlook supported). If the completion is called with no error, you may then invoke -[BREReceiptManager getEReceiptsWithCompletion:]

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -storeImapCredentials:andPassword:forProvider:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: For IMAP providers (currently AOL and Yahoo) you must store the credentials prior to calling -[BREReceiptManager getEReceiptsWithCompletion:]

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -verifyImapCredentials:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Verifies that stored IMAP credentials are valid

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -getEReceiptsWithCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Attempts to retrieve new (since last check) e-receipts from the stored e-mail account. You must have successfully authenticated an OAuth provider, or stored IMAP credentials prior to calling this method

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -signOut
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Signs out of any stored email account and stored e-receipt info. For OAuth providers this signs out of the provider and invalidates the access token. For IMAP providers this removes stored credentails.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -resetEmailsChecked
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Resets emails so you don’t need to log out and log in during testing

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: amazonDayCutoff
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Set this property to control how far back in the user’s Amazon history to search for orders

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -grabNewAmazonOrders:
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: This method grabs any incremental orders found on the user’s Amazon account. An incremental order is defined as an order that has not been previously returned, or an order previously returned but with a new status (i.e. if the status of any items changes from Processing to Shipped)

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -storeCredentials:password:
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Store the user’s Amazon credentials in the keychain

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -clearAmazonCredentials
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: This method must be called to clear the Amazon credentials if switching Amazon accounts or if, for example, the user changes their Amazon password and -[BRAmazonManager grabNewAmazonOrders:] starts returning error codes.

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -resetAmazonOrders
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Reset the stored history of Amazon orders

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -verifyAmazonAccount:
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Attempts to verify the stored Amazon credentials

Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -showBrowserFromViewController:withCompletion:
Classes/BRAmazonManager.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Shows a view controller containing a web view that allows
